elements.title: Tobit and Anna with the Kid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rembrandt drew heavily on two copperplate engravings of earlier works by other artists for the composition of Tobit and Anna with the Kid (pictured)?

elements.title: Marcel Słodki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Polish-Jewish Post-Impressionist painter and Dadaist Marcel Słodki was arrested by the Germans in France and died in Auschwitz concentration camp?

elements.title: Valley Public Television (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Valley Public Television once raffled off a 1961 Rolls-Royce Silver Cloud, according to the wishes of the man who bequeathed it to the station?

elements.title: Sheila P. Burke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sheila P. Burke was once known as the 101st U.S. senator?

elements.title: Hotel Belleclaire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a guest smuggled a lion into the Hotel Belleclaire using a piano crate, the lion was thrown out of the hotel?

elements.title: Ben Ofoedu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vanessa Feltz's ex-fiancé Ben Ofoedu sang on hits by Benz, Phats & Small, and Intenso Project?

elements.title: Chicano Liberation Front (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Chicano Liberation Front claimed responsibility for 28 bombings in Los Angeles in 1970 and 1971?

elements.title: Lester Rowe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it once took two days to determine whether a slam dunk by Lester Rowe at the buzzer counted?
